alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 9:11PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to remain high as water moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point at Sanford is forecast to remain near the record crest of 8.9 feet today before beginning a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts this week. For the St. Johns River...including Sanford...Major flooding is forecast to continue through this week. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This exceeds the flood of record. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Sanford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding becomes more significant to the Sanford waterfront area. Water approaches low lying areas on the waterfront. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Monday was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 8.6 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat St Johns River Sanford 5.5 8.9 Mon 8 pm 8.9 8.8 8.7 8.6 8.6 &&
